item.title: Best Strategy Games With The Most Immersive Mechanics
item.description:
Summary

  • FTL: Faster Than Light offers immersive gameplay through strategic spaceship battles.
  • Griftlands combines RPG mechanics with deck-building for a more immersive experience.
  • Duskers' unique command system creates tension and immersion in a dangerous environment.

Typical strategy games aren't exactly known for immersing players, often celebrated for complex systems and mechanical depth above anything else. However, there are some that offer immersion through their mechanics.

This often comes in the form of mechanics that represent something more physical, rather than being abstracted. A heavy focus on theme also helps to provide immersive gameplay, with titles such as Dune: Spice Wars baking their theme into the very design of the game.

7 FTL: Faster Than Light

Detailed Real-Time Spaceship Battles

On the run from dangerous pursuers and light on fuel and supplies, FTL: Faster Than Light throws players into a tense and strategic crucible. In the game, players are tasked with commanding a spaceship and its crew in real-time combat encounters, keeping their ship afloat between engagements by navigating a variety of random events.

FTL features many immersive mechanics, from its power supply management and individual ship systems to its simulated fires and oxygen supply. This immersive framework facilitates emergent gameplay that's often chaotic, creating tense spaceship battles that make the micromanagement of crew members a delightfully stressful task.

6 Griftlands

A Deck-Builder Elevated By Immersive RPG Mechanics

Griftlands is a roguelike deck-builder that stands out from the crowd with a generous helping of RPG mechanics. In the game, players are able to approach obstacles from multiple angles via the addition of a second combat system for negotiation.

This dual combat system allows for more role-playing opportunities, resulting in a more immersive experience. This is further supported by a reputation system that provides clear consequences and even benefits for the player's actions.

5 Duskers

A Unique & Intense Command System

Matching and even supporting the gritty, dark, and tense atmosphere of Duskers is its unique core mechanic, which tasks players with commanding units via a computer console. This creates a slow-paced gameplay loop that rewards cautious and methodical play, furthered by a world that's full of danger and at all times ready to punish reckless players.

In the game, players must lead a small group of drones through derelict spaceships, being careful not to stumble onto lurking threats and hazards. The dangerous nature of its environments synergizes with the slow and deliberately clunky control system, resulting in a palpable tension that, in combination with ambient sound design and stylized visuals, is tremendously immersive.

4 Dune: Imperium

Deck-Building Strategy Built Around The Source Material

Dune: Imperium may be stylistically simple in its approach, but the deep and complex design beneath its hood offers a rewarding set of systems that are a joy to unpack. The deck-building and worker-placement mechanics at the heart of Dune: Imperium are, on paper, rather dry. However, the thematic board spaces and frequent nods to the source material make for evocative mechanics that help to ground players in the world.

A particularly thematic aspect of Dune: Imperium is its interpretation of the source material's factions and the political interplay between them. In Dune: Imperium , this is represented via a faction track that players can manipulate to improve their reputation with a variety of Dune's iconic groups.

3 Cobalt Core

A Thematic & Cozy Sci-Fi Deck-Builder

This cozy roguelike deck-builder succeeds with its colorful pixel-art style, charming characters, and soothing soundtrack. However, its gameplay is both innovative and thematic, offering an immersive combat system that deepens the game's atmosphere.

In the game, players command a spaceship in tactical battles using a customizable deck of cards. These cards come in a variety of flavors, and this depends on which crew members the player chooses to bring along. Crew members also spout dialogue on certain triggers, breathing life into combat encounters and making the crew feel less like decorations and more like a part of the game.

2 Darkest Dungeon

A Gritty RPG Dungeon-Crawler With Punishing Gameplay

Darkest Dungeon is a strategy RPG that makes use of a roguelike structure to offer a deeply unforgiving experience. This goes hand in hand with the game's grim-dark fantasy setting and Gothic art style, providing a synergistic experience that can be incredibly immersive. Though its narrator, whose gravitas is unparalleled, does a great deal of heavy lifting, it's the game's thematic mechanics that ground the experience.

More specifically, Darkest Dungeon features a variety of character quirks that not only breathe more life into each adventurer but also provide unique challenges and benefits. Furthermore, the game's stress system, while at times frustrating, adds to the downtrodden tone and defeated attitude of Darkest Dungeon's characters. While it sounds depressing on paper, this boiling pot of darkness only makes the moments of triumph all the more memorable.

1 Dune: Spice Wars

4X Real-Time Strategy Centered Around Dune's Harsh Environments

Dune: Spice Wars is a deeply thematic combination of 4X and RTS mechanics. The game's dedication and frequent nods to the iconic source material certainly help, but it's the way in which its design synergizes with the theme that makes it so immersive.

In keeping with the source material, Dune: Spice Wars revolves heavily around political intrigue, conflict, and, of course, spice. The asymmetric factions of Dune: Spice Wars are also tremendously evocative, each featuring uniquely thematic mechanics that ground them in the world and encourage their own strategies. The iconic sandworms are also present here, offering yet another system to play around throughout each match.

item.title: Persona 5 Royal: Every Confidant In The Game, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Persona 5 is a top-tier JRPG with engaging characters and compelling gameplay.
  • Building strong bonds with Confidants unlocks powerful benefits in and out of combat.
  • Maxing out Social Links with key characters leads to access to high-level, game-changing Personas.

Persona 5 Royal is both one of the best games made by developer Atlus and also one of the best JRPGs made this generation; packed with hours and hours of gameplay for players to enjoy and a slew of activities. Be it regular combat or just its charming life sim elements, players will find themselves quickly falling in love with this game. What stands out above the other elements of the game, however, are the characters.

More specifically called confidants to Persona 5, these characters not only provide the player with engaging dialogue but if players spend enough time with them and strengthen their bond, they will prove useful to the protagonist in combat as well. The best Persona 5 confidants are notable for both their likability and usefulness. While some people may argue that every Confidant in Persona 5 is worth interacting with, there's no denying that prioritizing some will make for an objectively better experience with the game, especially if players unlock their benefits early on to make the most of the useful advantages they provide.

Updated on March 18, 2025: This article has been updated to include every confidant in the game based on the Royal edition of the game. While there is a spoiler warning below, these confidants are deeply intertwined with the story elements added in the Royal content, and being surprised by them on a first playthrough is best. The Akechi confidant did exist in base Persona 5, though for this article we'll only be focusing on that confidant in the Royal edition of the game since it was refurbished in a lot of good ways.

***** Spoiler warning for Persona 5 Royal 's story and character arcs, including the ending *****

23 Ichiko Ohya

Devil Arcana

  • A powerless adult who lost so much when fighting for what's right.

Ohya is one of the few confidants who gives a closer view of the effects of the rotten adults in society who are bending the world to their will. While the Phantom Thieves see themselves as powerless because they are kids, Ohya shows that you can still be powerless and be an adult.

While her confidant can easily be missed, it does give good hints at Shido long before he's fully introduced in the story. That all being said, Ohya's personality can be a little off-putting to some people, and the confidant overall has Joker being more someone Ohya talks to than him helping her through her situation, landing her at the bottom of this list.

22 Shinya Oda

Tower Arcana

  • A kid who just wants to protect those important to him by any means necessary.

Shinya offers an even more childlike view of the world than the Phantom Thieves. While he understands there are some bad people in the world you need to fight against, his child-like worldview leads him to go too far with it.

Shinya paints the world in even darker shades of black and white than the Phantom Thieves do and offers helpful insight into why some levels of moderation are important. While his confidant isn't necessarily bad, it can be hard to remember he's only a kid when he goes to the extremes when wanting to deal with someone he sees as a problem.

21 Haru Okumura

Empress Arcana

  • Makes a conscious effort to be more involved in the running of Okumura Foods.

It's a shame that Haru's Confidant is unlocked very late into the game, given that she's the final playable character players get to control. While the game is lengthy enough that players should still have enough time to interact with her, players who are new to the game can potentially end up not completing her Confidant because of how it's unlocked and the Max Proficiency requirement, which can stall players.

However, people who make the effort to interact with one of the best Confidants in Persona 5 Royal will witness a story that is in line with Mitsuru's from Persona 3 . After her father's fall from grace, Haru is thrust into the role of the heir apparent and feels forced to do what's best for her family's company instead of what she believes in. Not only does the protagonist help her forge her own path, but he can also convince her to avoid an arranged marriage and initiate a relationship with Joker instead.

20 Yusuke Kitagawa

Emperor Arcana

  • Regains his mojo for painting after learning about how Madarame just used him for his own gain.

There's no denying that Yusuke gives off a very poor first impression, with his clichéd, tortured artist personality and a weird insistence on painting Ann naked making him more unlikable than was necessary (or likely intended). However, it doesn't take long for Yusuke to come into his own and finally stand against Madarame, awakening his Persona in the process. While the person who profited off his name was eventually exposed, this event led to Yusuke losing his mojo for making art.

The protagonist spends a lot of time with Yusuke as he goes through an artistic crisis. A piece he puts his heart and soul into ends up being rejected, and Yusuke realizes that his inspiration needs to come naturally to him. Forcing himself to paint when he had no vision was a futile endeavor, and Yusuke eventually crafts a piece that is beautiful and is arguably on par with Sayuri's quality, if not better. It's a wild journey that cements this party member as one of the best Confidants in Persona 5 Royal .

19 Ann Takamaki

Lovers Arcana

  • Becomes more confident when it comes to modeling.

It's easy to write off Ann as a character who's absorbed by her own looks and faces no problems because of her beauty. However, this couldn't be further from the truth, and it's not until this character awakens her Persona that players realize that there's more to this blonde than meets the eye. After Kamoshida's dungeon is over and done with, players can really get to know Ann by progressing her Confidant.

Joker accompanies Ann on her modeling ventures, encountering a nemesis who tries to sabotage Ann's future prospects. While she loses her zeal midway through, the protagonist eventually helps Ann regain her confidence before coming out on top of the modeling world once again. This can culminate in a beautiful romance, capping off the journey of one of Persona 5 Royal 's best Confidants .

18 Igor

Fool Arcana

  • A fake version of an iconic character who fools Joker for the majority of the game.

Terrifying to look upon, this prison warden of one's cognitive gaol is the Confidant for the Fool Arcana, which often represents the protagonist in both Persona games and in lore related to Tarot cards. His intense visage, deep voice, and vast knowledge make interactions with him unique, though, in doing so the player will also eventually be able to summon the most powerful Persona from the Fool Arana (in New Game+ and with the required components).

Satanael is usually first seen as the final form of Arsène that emerges when the protagonist shatters the chains binding them. However, this is the only time they can be used in a first playthrough. This angel from Abrahamic mythology, usually associated with rebellion and fallen angels, is a level 95 Persona that possesses severely damaging offensive skills that deal Almighty, Gun, and Nuclear damage as well as a plethora of awesome passive ones.

17 Morgana

Magician Arcana

  • A mysterious being who takes on the form of a cat in the real world.

Morgana is a character that many fans are really split down the middle about. This cat has the ability to interact with other users of the Metaverse's power and plays a pivotal role in the story by shaping his bond with Joker.

The best thing about his Arcana is that it naturally develops over the course of the story as well, which is something fans would definitely appreciate. This, coupled with some memorable story beats that place Morgana front and center, leads to this lovable cat having a fairly memorable arc of his own.

Maxing out his Arcana lets players form Futsunushi, the God of Swords. Suffice it to say, Joker will gain access to a wide array of helpful melee abilities after fusing this Persona.

16 Ryuji Sakamoto

Chariot Arcana

  • Joker's best friend and a track-running specialist who has it out for Kamoshida and his abusive ways.

Ryuji fills the role of the protagonist's clumsy yet good-hearted friend who sticks by his side from the very start of the game. It's a cliche that has remained in the Persona games since the third game and has consistently delivered.

Ryuji's side story explores his relationship with the track team, which was halted after Kamoshida's vile actions. It's a great story that sees him reconcile his bonds with his fellow track mates and become closer to Joker as well. Maxing out the Chariot Arcana gives players access to Chi You, a powerful Psy-based Persona with some of the best attacks of this element in the game.

15 Makoto Niijima

Priestess Arcana

  • The student council president of Shujin Academy, who stops being the principal's pawn after a point.

This scholarly student and cognitive world biker badass is the Confidant for the Priestess Arcana and a valuable member of the player's party. She also has a huge part in the story and in supporting Joker throughout the game. Spending time with Makoto will eventually max out the Social Link and grant access to the mighty Greco-Roman goddess Cybele, who was said to be a protector of many cities.

In Persona 5 , this deity manifests as an excellent 'White Mage' archetype that has great healing and support skills as well as an attack that unleashes heavy Bless damage to all foes. At level 73, they sit atop this Arcana's summon-tier list.

It helps that Makoto herself is a very fun character to interact with. Her concern for her friends makes the misunderstood student council president one of the most interesting characters in the game that many people consider to be the best waifu by a country mile.

14 Sae Niijima

Judgement Arcana

  • A prosecutor and Makoto's sister who is too invested in her work to give her sibling the attention she needs.

The older sister of Makoto and also an interrogator attempting to gain information from Joker, Sae Niijima is the Confidant for the Judgement Arcana as well as the possessor of a Palace. Throughout the course of the game, the player will be faced with her questions, and if one answers correctly, they will be able to max out their Social Link with her and unlock the ability to summon the dreaded fallen angel themself, Satan.

In addition to straight-up broken passive skills, such as automatic regeneration of some SP after each turn, Satan is a level 92 Persona that is equipped with multiple severely damaging Ice skills and a unique one that can unleash colossal Almighty damage to a single target aptly named Black Viper.

13 Sojiro Sakura

Hierophant Arcana

  • The owner of Cafe Leblanc and Joker's guardian when he's forced to move to Tokyo.

Sojiro Sakura is not only the First Confidant introduced in the game but also one of the first characters the protagonist will meet at the beginning of his journey. Sojiro might seem like a jerk at the beginning of the game, but he quickly takes a liking to the protagonist and turns out to be quite a cool guy.

As the only parental figure the protagonist has during his journey, he teaches him to make coffee and even cook curry. If the player manages to max out this Confidant, they can then make exquisite coffee that can then be used to restore the entire party's SP, which is especially helpful for a lot of the later palaces.

When one's Social Link with Sojiro has been maxed out, players will gain access to the most powerful persona in the Hierophant Arcana that the coffee-maker represents. This persona is the level 76 golden dragon Kohryu that boasts immensely powerful offensive Psychic skills as well as quite a few excellent automatic ones. They also have the devastating Concentrate skill, which boosts the damage dealt by the next magical attack used by a colossal 250%.

12 Yuuki Mishima

Moon Arcana

  • Joker's classmate who runs the Phantom Thieves website, getting drunk on its power before finally seeing the light after his presence in Mementos is vanquished.

This is the number one fan of the Phantom Thieves. Although he's introduced to players as a lame character at first, Yuuki Mishima proves himself a useful confidant to have and provides the Phantom Thieves helpful information and even creates the titular Phansite.

And as a fan of the Phantom Thieves, it's no wonder that his Confidant skill when maxed out affects the whole party, letting all party members earn the same amount of XP even when not fighting. This greatly helps players looking to do some grinding.

Yuuki is the Confidant for the Moon Arcana, and as such, maxing the social link with him will grant access to the most powerful persona in this group: the angel Sandalphon. This level 75 heavenly figure has polarizing traits, though both kinds are tremendously useful to players. On one hand, Sandalphon has some of the best support skills in the game such as Amrita Shower, which cures the entire party of status ailments. On the other, they have an instant death skill that targets all foes simultaneously, a colossally damaging physical skill, as well as a severely damaging Almighty one.

11 Munehisa Iwai

Hanged Man Arcana

  • A mysterious weapons dealer who slowly opens up to Joker as the Confidant progresses.

At first, Iwai seems like a shady character who deals in all sorts of weaponry and seemingly gets Joker into some questionable circumstances. While that doesn't change much, his shop still offers a lot of useful weapons, especially customizable guns for Joker and the entire party to use.

When his Confidant rank is maxed, Players will be able to create unique firearms to use in dungeons, cause it's always good to pack a little extra punch in battle.

As the Confidant representing the Hanged Man Arcana, Iwai's maxed-out Social Link will result in players being able to summon the level 82 Attis. In addition to having a couple of great offensive Fire skills, Attis has many great support ones, such as Salvation, which fully heals the party's HP as well as cures all status ailments from all party members. This high-level persona from Greek mythology can also revive a single ally with full HP with their Samarecarm skill.

10 Caroline & Justine

Strength Arcana

  • The twins in the Velvet Room who help the protagonist unlock more means of fusing Personas if he completes their requests.

Caroline and Justine are the twins that the protagonist will meet at the start of the game. These characters are quite important too as they help the player gain powerful personas through fusion and other methods.

And if the player happens to max out this Strength Arcana Confidant, they'll be able to fuse a persona of a higher level than the player, which cannot be stressed enough how useful this is as it'll enable them to create stronger personas.

Maxing out the Social Link with this duo will also allow players to summon the mighty level 80 Zaou-Gongen of Eastern mythology. This persona comes with deadly Fire skills to scorch foes with, though also possesses a colossally damaging physical one as well as great automatic skills that benefit one's survivability in addition to boosting Gun-type damage by 50%.

9 Toranosuke Yoshida

Sun Arcana

  • One of the few politicians who strived for justice and fairness after being caught in a corruption scandal that served as a major setback for his career.

Yoshida is a seasoned politician whom the protagonist will meet quite early on in the game. He teaches him a bunch of real-life lessons as well as allows him to gain a bunch of skills, such as demanding more money from cornered enemies in combat.

Once this Confidant has been maxed out, players will be able to convince personas to join their ranks even if they are at a higher level. Which again, is useful as players will have a bunch of higher leveled personas at their disposal.

This Confidant represents the Sun Arcana and grants players the ability to fuse forth the impressive level 76 Asura. This powerful persona has some of the best Nuclear skills in the game with one that deals severe damage to a single and another that unleashes heavy damage to all enemies simultaneously. On top of this, they have an automatic skill that grants a 20% chance to reflect all physical attacks.

8 Sadayo Kawakami

Temperance Arcana

  • A homeroom teacher who masquerades as a maid at night to pay off her sick sister's bills.

As the teacher to the protagonist, the two have an interesting relationship, to say the least. As one of the earlier confidants, she is definitely the most useful to new players; as she helps Joker in a variety of ways, such as doing laundry, making coffee, and even helping with crafting infiltration tools.

Max her rank, however, and players will be able to partake in more activities during the night, which makes carrying out tasks a lot more efficient in the game.

Kawakami will also give players another stellar high-level persona to summon, this time from the Temperance Arcana, as maxing one's Social Link with her lets one fuse Ardha from Hindu mythology. This level 84 duel-identity deity possesses great physical and Nuclear skills in addition to also having Salvation, which is one of the best support skills for its excellent healing and curative effects.

7 Chihaya Mifune

Fortune Arcana

  • A fortune teller with a heart of gold who decides to make up for unwittingly duping people into spending money for what is essentially a scam.

Mifune is the quirky fortune teller the player will meet about halfway into the game. As odd as she may seem in the beginning, her fortune-telling prowess is nothing to scoff at.

Her confidant skill allows the player to better their relationship with other confidants and even lets them see all the current Confidant's abilities in advance, once the player maxes her rank. This is especially handy when a player wants to max out only the necessary confidants.

This Confidant for the Fortune Arcana also yields a great ally in Lakshmi, the level 69 apex of this group's personas. This figure from the Hindu pantheon offers excellent healing skills as well as an automatic one called Life Aid, which returns 8% of one's total HP and SP after a victorious battle. She can also assail all adversaries with a heavy Ice skill and even put many of them to sleep with another ability of the same element.

6 Hifumi Togo

Star Arcana

  • A professional Shogi player whose reputation as a prodigy is more of a curse than a boon.

Hifumi is a professional Shogi player and a potential love interest to the protagonist. Hifumi is really smart, and when progressing her Confidant rank, it’s no wonder the strategies learned from her teachings will be useful in real combat situations in the game.

Once players max out this Confidant, they can then swap out team members in the dungeons for ones by the sideline. This is especially useful when a character has low Health or SP.

As the Confidant for the Star Arcana, Togo lets players attain one of the best Personas in the entire franchise: Lucifer. At level 93, this fallen angel accordingly has tremendously potent skills that, frankly, make him straight-up broken. His Gigantomachia skill unleashes colossal physical damage against all enemies at once for a devastating move that can wipe out entire opposing parties in a single turn. He also has Morning Star, which does the same as Gigantomachia, though with magical Almighty damage. Furthermore, Lucifer has automatic skills that make magical attacks cost 50% less SP and another that lets him absorb all incoming physical attacks.

5 Tae Takemi

Death Arcana

  • A doctor who strives to regain her soiled reputation by performing suspect clinical trials on Joker.

Perhaps one of the most useful and generally loved characters in the game. Tae is quite beneficial as she provides the protagonist with numerous types of healing items that prove helpful in clearing out palaces. Keep increasing her confidant rank, and players will be able to gain more advanced healing items from her shop. Once players finally reach the max rank, they'll have access to the strongest healing items in the game, which is especially useful for end-game bosses and enemies.

Another great boon Tae offers when one's Social Link with her is maxed out is access to the Death Arcana's top persona, Alice. This creepy child-like spirit is a level-79 monster in disguise that possesses a few skills that make her feared by all foes. Firstly is her Concentrate buff, which can line up a devastating attack for the next turn. Secondly is her Megidolaon skill, which unleashes severe Almighty damage to all enemies. Finally, and most deadly, is her aptly named Die For Me! skill, which has a high chance of instantly killing all foes.

4 Futaba Sakura

Hermit Arcana

  • A shut-in who's befriended and encouraged to come out of her shell by the Phantom Thieves.

Futaba is another one of the community's fan favorites and a very lovable character. Although Futaba is a central character and part of the Phantom Thieves, unlike the others on this list, it's safe to say she's still a very important confidant as well.

Players won't be able to unlock Futaba till right near the final palaces, which makes her one of the later confidants in the game. Once players manage to rank her up, though, she'll prove useful in palaces in many ways from providing moral support, which recovers SP, to shielding allies from a fatal blow.

For those seeking one of the most efficient, physical skill-oriented personas, be sure to max out one's Social Link with this Confidant for the Hermit Arcana, for doing so unlocks the original ninja from Japanese mythology: Ongyo-Ki. This level 75 ninjutsu-knowing one has a couple of skills that land multiple hits per turn as well as automatic ones that reduce the cost of all physical skills and even restore 6% HP every turn.

item.title: 7 Best Games Dark Souls Fans Should Try That Aren't Souls-Likes
item.description:
Summary

  • Tunic, inspired by Zelda, offers souls-like elements and exploration, appealing to fans of Dark Souls.
  • Lunacid, a dungeon-crawler with immersive ambiance, may attract Dark Souls fans seeking exploration over action.
  • Gloomwood's focus on interconnected exploration rather than action gameplay could appeal to certain Dark Souls enthusiasts.

FromSoftware's Dark Souls is loved for many reasons. Be it the game's distinctive dark-fantasy world, ensemble cast of quirky characters, punishing difficulty, or impressive boss battles, there's a lot to love.

Many games have capitalized on the success of Dark Souls , giving way to an entire genre. These games usually feature the same ARPG gameplay, with an emphasis on dodge rolls, stamina management, and intense difficulty. They're also known to feature elements of the Metroidvania genre with pseudo-open-world designs. However, there are a variety of games outside of this souls-like genre that Dark Souls fans are sure to appreciate. Immersive and mysterious atmospheres, interconnected worlds, dark fantasy settings, and challenging combat are all on the table.

7 TUNIC

A Zelda-Like Adventure With Souls-Like Elements

Though it features souls-like elements in the form of stamina management, a dodge roll, and impressive boss battles, TUNIC is quite obviously adjacent to games such as The Legend Of Zelda . As a result of its similarities, however, TUNIC is more than likely to appeal to Dark Souls fans.

Although its charming, cutesy aesthetic is the polar opposite of Dark Souls' Gothic fantasy world, TUNIC maintains the same enigmatic atmosphere. Similarly to Dark Souls , this is thanks to a lack of hand-holding, and TUNIC takes this a step further by mystifying its tutorial with a fictional language presented in a nostalgic game manual.

6 Lunacid

A First-Person Dungeon-Crawler With A Somber Tone

This slow-paced first-person dungeon-crawler, influenced by games such as King's Field and Shadow Tower , excels with its immersive atmosphere. The dense ambiance of Lunacid's locations, supported by a dream-like soundtrack, is sure to appeal to certain Dark Souls fans.

However, the moment-to-moment gameplay isn't quite as refined as Dark Souls , and it's decidedly slower in pace. As a result, Lunacid is more likely to appeal to Dark Souls fans looking for more of that immersive exploration, rather than an action-packed gauntlet of enemies and boss battles.

5 Gloomwood

Methodical Gameplay With A Focus On Exploration

Gloomwood doesn't play at all like Dark Souls ; it's a first-person immersive sim with a heavy focus on stealth and survival-horror mechanics. However, the interconnected nature of the game's world and the heavy focus on exploration that comes along with it is more than likely to appeal to particular fans of Dark Souls .

Like Dark Souls , Gloomwood rewards the curious, encouraging players to explore thoroughly by using challenge as motivation. In Gloomwood , this comes from mechanics rooted in the survival-horror genre; designated save rooms and heavily limited resources provide a natural ebb and flow of desperation and sharp relief.

4 Animal Well

Thoughtful Exploration In A Mysterious Underground World

Animal Well is a game unlike many others, dropping players into an exotic underground well with little to no information and continuing this sense of enigma throughout. This is supported by the game's visual style, sound design, and interconnected world, which help to make exploration a truly immersive experience.

The sense of discovery that this design facilitates is, arguably, on par with games such as Dark Souls , from the opening of shortcuts to the abundance of secrets. As a result, Dark Souls fans who don't mind forgoing combat may get some familiar chills from Animal Well .

3 Darkest Dungeon

A Challenging Dark Fantasy RPG

Fans of Dark Souls looking for more brutally difficult games should look no further than Darkest Dungeon . Despite its focus on turn-based strategy over skillful action, Darkest Dungeon 's downtrodden tone, grim-dark fantasy setting, and unforgiving gameplay are sure to please certain Dark Souls fans.

There's little in the way of exploration, at least on a large scale, but players who enjoyed Dark Souls for its challenging gameplay will find plenty to love with Darkest Dungeon . Furthermore, the Gothic nature of Darkest Dungeon 's world and the hopelessness of its characters is a stone's throw from the iconic realm of Lordran.

2 Resident Evil

Locks, Keys, Challenge, & Methodical Exploration

Resident Evil is a far cry from Dark Souls in many ways, that much will be immediately apparent to many. However, there are many qualities to the first Resident Evil title that are sure to give certain Dark Souls fans a kick. Resident Evil does not feature RPG systems or expressive combat; rather, its gameplay is relatively clunky. Despite this, Resident Evil's lock-and-key structure and the dynamic nature of its environments will likely scratch a very specific itch for fans of Dark Souls .

Certainly, Resident Evil is also different in theme, but both games feature a cast of horrifying enemies. There's also something to be said about Resident Evil's safe rooms and the feelings that they evoke, especially later on in the game; fans looking for more of the overwhelming reprieve that comes with finally reaching a bonfire in Dark Souls will surely appreciate the rare but vital safe rooms in Resident Evil .

1 Hollow Knight

An Interconnected World With A Melancholic Atmosphere

Though Hollow Knight shares many similarities with Dark Souls , it's a Metroidvania above all else. Most notably, Hollow Knight features very little in the way of RPG elements. However, despite its differences, Dark Souls fans are still sure to enjoy exploring the deep and atmospheric world of Hallownest.

The game's atmosphere and the interconnected nature of its world are key qualities here, with subtle world-building and cryptic, environmental storytelling sprinkled throughout. The game's abundance of boss fights, scattered save points, and quirky NPCs are also familiar, offering a memorable journey that constantly offers players a sense of discovery.

item.title: WWE 2K25: How To Unlock Big Poppa Pump Scott Steiner
item.description:
In addition to the classic 90s tag team version of Scott Steiner, you can unlock the Big Poppa Pump version and make him a member of your roster in WWE 2K25. In last year's entry, this version of Scott Steiner was only available through unlocking him in MyFaction using costly microtransactions and a lot of luck.

Luckily, he is available for free by playing through MyRise in WWE 2K25 and making the correct decisions. Furthermore, you'll unlock other WWE legends made playable and a permanent part of your roster for the Universe Mode and exhibition matches.

How To Unlock Scott Steiner In WWE 2K25

Many of the unlockable characters in WWE 2K25 are unlockable through MyRise. The majority of characters in the story mode are fictional, but some noteworthy characters make enduring MyRise mode less tedious. A major addition is the Big Poppa Pump version of Scott Steiner, complete with his iconic siren entrance music and chainmail headpiece. Use the following steps to unlock Scott Steiner '03 in the fastest way possible:

In addition to Scott Steiner, you'll also unlock Alundra Blayze (Madusa in WCW) and the modern version of Diamon Dallas Page (DDP).

  • If you want to complete the MyRise content as quickly as possible, you should switch the game to Easy Mode and consider adjusting the gameplay sliders in WWE 2K25.
  • You can skip most conversations, but be careful about skipping too quickly as there are some dialogue choices. Unfortunately, you can't skip the cutscenes.
  • As you progress through the story, make sure to allocate your attribute points to your male wrestler for an easier time finishing matches.
  • Keep working through the Myrise story mode until you get to Chapter 9.
  • Chapter 9 features the most crucial choice that will allow you to unlock Scott Steiner.
  • After completing the Survivor Series sequence, you'll presented with two choices :
  1. Continue with your first (male) character to get the Reclaim ending.
  2. Continue with your second character (female) to get the Conquer ending.
  • Select the Reclaim ending and continue with your first character.
  • After several conversations, matches, and cutscenes, you will eventually have another choice: Recruit WWE Legends, Recruit Indie Wrestlers, or Recruit Past 2K MyPlayer Characters. Make sure to select "Recruit WWE Legends. "
  • After making your selection for the Legends you'll get to wrestle at a convention for WWE Legends and meet with DDP and Trish Stratus. You'll get a choice between wrestling Alundra Blayze or Scott Steiner. It doesn't matter who you choose, but it may be more fun to wrestle Steiner since the goal is to unlock him for your WWE roster.
  • Complete Chapter 9 to unlock Scott Steiner, a modern DDP, and Alundra Blayze.

That's everything required to add Big Poppa Pump Scott Steiner to your roster in WWE 2K25.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: High Rank Charge Blade Build
item.description:
The Charge Blade is one of the most complex weapons in Monster Hunter Wilds , requiring players to understand the combos the weapon can execute and the precise timing to switch its forms. Mastering this kit takes time, but once achieved, it grants access to one of the best equipment options in the game. This process demands patience and practice; however, the reward is a highly versatile weapon setup.

To take full advantage of what it offers in the endgame, a strong build for the Charge Blade in the High Rank of Monster Hunter Wilds is essential. With the proper items and equipment, players can maximize the weapon's damage potential, ensuring that battles against various enemies encountered at this stage are comparatively easier to manage, creating a strategy that proves vital in challenging encounters.

How This Charge Blade Build Works In Monster Hunter Wilds

One of the main aspects of the Charge Blade is the Savage Axe skill. There are several ways to activate it during combat, but the simplest is by executing Focus Attacks on an enemy wound. This activation triggers another weapon mechanic that allows players to deal increased damage, as the gear delivers a high number of sequential attacks against foes in just a few seconds. Also, this approach enhances overall combat effectiveness.

Many elements of this Charge Blade build in Monster Hunter Wilds are designed so that, once access is granted to the weapons and armor of the High Rank, maximum damage is achieved with Savage Axe Mode when striking enemies. In addition, players should remain alert to the different Phials and their specific uses against each creature encountered during a hunt, as these are fundamental for the weapon's effective operation.

It is also worth noting that due to the Charge Blade's complexity, various builds may be viable throughout the game , especially in the endgame of Monster Hunter Wilds . Different combinations can be crafted to emphasize specific aspects of the weapon's capabilities, so several equipment setups and decorations can be effective, depending on the desired focus for the Charge Blade. This flexibility allows hunters to tailor their play style in may ways.

Many High Rank builds in Monster Hunter Wilds revolve around the Frenzy skill, and the Charge Blade is no exception. This skill is activated when players equip two or four pieces of the Gore Mangala Set on their character, granting a bonus to affinity that increases the rate of critical hits. For hunters focused on maximizing DPS, this is an essential skill.

However, while these bonuses can be game-changers in Monster Hunter Wilds , the Frenzy skill also carries a drawback in its mechanics . When entering combat with large monsters, players are affected by a debuff that prevents gradual health regeneration and increases the damage taken when hit. Over time, this effect is mitigated as attacks land on the enemy, which in turn boosts the affinity bonuses of the weapon.

Therefore, along with the Gore Mangala set, players should also include certain decorations that provide Antivirus, as they complement the Frenzy skill well. These decorations help recover from the debuffs caused at the start of battle; once overcome, they grant an increased affinity bonus, proving ideal for longer High Rank fights, where the opportunities to benefit from the Antivirus bonus are even greater.

Another important skill for this Charge Blade build in the endgame of Monster Hunter Wilds is the Agitator. It offers an increase in attack and affinity when enemy creatures enter Enraged mode, a moment that can be recognized when foes yell and their map icons turn red. Capitalizing on these moments in combat is crucial for the build, and it is a skill that should be consistently monitored while crafting equipment.

Finally, not only for this Charge Blade build but for all setups created for this weapon in Monster Hunter Wilds , the Load Shells skill, obtainable via the Magazine Jewel, works well with the weapon's other mechanics. Its effect increases the speed at which Phials are reloaded, allowing players to use its benefits earlier in combat, allowing players to use its benefits earlier in combat, making such an advantage prove crucial in prolonged battles.

Best Charge Blade Weapon Options

Typically, the best version of Chrono Gear in Monster Hunter Wilds is the one with paralysis , effectively combining elements such as excellent damage, good decoration slots, and the ability to inflict Status Effect on enemies during combat. However, if this option is not available, Lala Eumenophor serves as a strong alternative. This setup offers balanced performance and consistently reliable outcomes.

Although Status Effect is one of the Charge Blade's strengths, it also functions as elemental damage. However, if players opt for this change, some adjustments to the build are necessary. The main change is to replace the Helm with the G Ebony Helm Beta , utilizing Tenderizer Jewel 3 and Chain Jewel 3 . Even with these adjustments, its effectiveness is not as high.

Skills Provided By Each Armor Piece In Charger Blade Build

  • G. Fulgur Helm Beta : Provides Agitator Level 2 (total build requires Level 5)
  • Arkvulcan Mail Beta : Grants Weakness Exploit Level 1
  • G. Arkveld Vambraces Beta : Grants Weakness Exploit Level 2
  • Gore Coil Beta : Provides Constitution Level 2
  • Gore Greaves Beta : Provides Antivirus Level 1 and Flinch Free Level 1
  • Talisman (Exploiter Charm II) : Grants Weakness Exploit to reach Level 5 in this skill

How To Play With This Charge Blade Build In Monster Hunter Wilds

Among the various ways to use the Charge Blade in Monster Hunter Wilds , this build focuses on the Savage Axe. During combat, players will aim to keep it activated as much as possible, whether through combos such as a Perfect Guard, Mounted Finisher, or, in the simplest method, by using Focus Strike on a monster wound. This tactic ensures that the weapon's powerful capabilities are consistently leveraged throughout each encounter.

Thus, during combat, the ideal approach is for players to concentrate all attacks on a single point of the adversary's body until injury marks begin to appear. This strategy facilitates the activation of Focus Strike and, consequently, Savage Axe Mode, which is essential to maximize DPS. Once Savage Axe is active, the main goal is to maintain a constant rotation of Element Discharge to extend its effect, ensuring each strike delivers maximum accumulated damage.

In addition to Savage Axe Mode, other essential tools of the Charge Blade, such as Super Amped Element Discharge (SAED) and Amped Element Discharge (AED), should be used whenever an opening in combat arises. These abilities consume loaded Phials and deliver a significant burst of damage, acting as perfect finishers after energy is built in Sword Mode. Utilizing these attacks ensures a high burst of damage, especially following a successful sequence of Perfect Guard or Focus Strike.
